required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Hispanic Men Building Respect Education and Safety (Family Men) - Substudy Under Center for Latino Research Opportunities (CLaRO)

collaborator.agency: National Institute on Minority Health and Health Disparities (NIMHD)

brief_summary.textblock: The overall objective of this project is to adapt and enhance HoMBReS (Hispanic Men Building Respect, Education, and Safety within Families /Hombres Manteniendo Respeto, Educacion y Seguridad de Familia), a CDC-identified best-evidence HIV behavioral intervention designed to reduce substance abuse, family violence, and HIV/AIDS (SAVA) among sexually active heterosexual Latino seasonal farmworkers (LSFWs) in rural areas.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in quantity of substance use
primary_outcome.description: As measured by the Time-Line Followback questionnaire with participants self-reporting number of drinks per day

primary_outcome.measure: Change in self-reported engagement in risky sexual behaviors
primary_outcome.description: As measured using the PhenX Toolkit Sexual Risk Behavior self-reported instrument utilizing the number of unprotected sexual encounters as well as number of sexual partners

primary_outcome.measure: Change in self-reported experiences of violence
primary_outcome.description: As measured using the PhenX Toolkit Exposures to Violence self-reported instrument

primary_outcome.measure: Change in frequency of substance use
primary_outcome.description: As measured by the Time-Line Followback self-reported questionnaire with participants self-reporting number days drinking

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Level of self-reported communication with son
secondary_outcome.description: As measured using the self-reported Parenting Practices Instrument, 12 item Parental Monitoring subscale rated on a 7-item Likert scale. Scores range from 0-72, with higher scores indicating higher levels of parental monitoring.

arm_group.description: Four sessions (2 sessions per week, approximately 1.5 hours each) with the fathers, in which facilitators conduct educational sessions with groups of 6-8 men per group. One of the sessions includes an intervention of families talking together.
One session of 1.5 hours held once per week. Session content will focus on the importance of physical activity, healthy eating, and maintaining a healthy weight.

intervention.description: The experimental group (group A) will receive an intervention based on social cognitive theory and empowerment education that aims to reduce risky sexual behaviors among recently migrated rural men.

The brief intervention, is a parent-based intervention to teach parents effective strategies proven to reduce adolescent sexual risk behavior. The intervention specifically targets the parent (not the adolescent) to: promote communication skills, build parent-adolescent relationships, develop effective monitoring strategies, and prepare them to teach adolescents assertiveness and substance abuse refusal skills.
Session content will focus on the importance of physical activity, healthy eating and maintaining a healthy weight.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- male
- adults (age 18 or above)
- farmworker
- Latino
- understand and speaks Spanish
- has an eligible son ( 11-17 years old)
Exclusion Criteria:
- father does not provide consent and permission for his son
- son does not provide assent
